instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3215: What is 820-3215? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
Hello,

I have strange problem with audio jack. When I start the machine headphones work. If I unplug and replug them, they stop working. If I restart the machine they work again. Speakers work normally. Audio codec? REF line? Please advice how to proceed.

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
OSX reacts when plug/unplug the headphones?
Check audio device properties.

Clean audio jack properly, vieos available on YouTube...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
When I first start OSX, headphones work and is detected in audio device properties.
If I disconnect and reconnect them, they are no longer detected in audio properties.
If I restart the machine while the headphones are plugged-in they will work again. And I can reproduce it every time. Not a random issue. Strange right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
Disconnect/reconnect headphines few times once in OSX.
See if something change.
If yes, should be dirty audio connector.
Clean it anyway...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message: Cleaned and replaced port - same problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
Check reaction on detect circuits from page 61 (<TRANSISTOR>Q6801</TRANSISTOR>-03), when connect/disconnect headphones.

Also check if headphones comes back if you just close/open lid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
Unplugged <TRANSISTOR>Q6801</TRANSISTOR>-03 - 4.3V
Plugged-in - 0V
Headphones detected after close/open lid.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
"Headphones detected after close/open lid."
I was expecting to check when headphones not available.
See if can recover without shuting down the machine; clos/open lid only.

"<TRANSISTOR>Q6801</TRANSISTOR>-03 - 4.3V"
3 transistors, with 3 and 6 pins; what should I understand???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
Sorry if I was confusing.
"Headphones detected after close/open lid." - In OS I plug in headphones and they are NOT detected. I close and open lid and they are suddenly detected.
All e transistors react when I plug in headphones.
<TRANSISTOR>Q6800</TRANSISTOR> pin 3 voltage drop from 2.37V to 0V
<TRANSISTOR>Q6801</TRANSISTOR> pin 3 voltage drop from 4.32V to 0V
<TRANSISTOR>Q6802</TRANSISTOR> pin 3 voltage drop from 4.45V to 4.16V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
When headphones not detected, there is still sound on internal speakers?
The f***g detection circuit can make you get crazy.
If headphones recovered after close/open lid, I will not waste more time.
Unless you have free time now, with the f***g crisis...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
Yes, when headphones not detected there is still sound on internal speakers. 
Looks like its a big pain in the ass. I will figure out another solution for this client.
Thanks for your help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
Remove <RESISTOR>R6805</RESISTOR>/13 and test again.
Check integrity of all resistors connected to <SIGNAL>AUD_SENSE_A</SIGNAL> line.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Headphone jack problem
threads.message:
I know this thread is exactly 2 years ago, I came across the same exact symptom.

It turned out being a broken trace on <SIGNAL>AUD_IPHS_SWITCH_EN</SIGNAL> between a test pad and <CHIP>U2152</CHIP>. 
The test pad is next to <RESISTOR>R6880</RESISTOR>-1 / <CHIP>U6880</CHIP>-3 (under the annoying foam).
<CHIP>U2152</CHIP> doesn't show up on boardview but it's the same on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3215</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (<CHIP>U2652</CHIP>).

Probably other issues may cause the same symptom but I thought it may be helpful for someone.
